definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
bucket/(trash) can/barrel (of oil etc)/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: The oil is then put into big vats and used for cooking.
sentences.chinese: 榨出來的油就裝在大桶子裏，用來炒菜。

sentences.english: For ice slush baths, fill a large bucket with water and ice.
sentences.chinese: 使用冰浴的時候，在一個大桶裏裝滿水和冰。

sentences.english: That's incredible. He poured a big barrel of water into his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 真是難以置信，他倒了一大桶水進他的嘴巴。

sentences.english: He tilted the barrel so as to empty it.
The wet vat method, for example, can be used to dye wool with onionskins .
sentences.chinese: 比如，大桶法可以用洋蔥皮爲羊毛染色。

sentences.english: the vinegar had been stored in barrels that previously contained antifreeze.
sentences.chinese: 食醋儲存在早先盛過抗凍劑的大桶裏。

sentences.english: You can also make a bigger mixture for their bedroom curtains.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以做一大桶的溶液，把你臥室的窗簾泡進來。

sentences.english: His father emptied sacks of stale rye bread into the vat .
sentences.chinese: 他父親把一袋袋發黴的黑麪包倒進大桶裏。

sentences.english: And the Cantonese side of me came out when I insisted on a big vat of chicken feet and mushroom soup.
sentences.chinese: 當我堅持要一大桶雞爪和蘑菇湯的時候粵方箱打開了。

sentences.english: Uncle Pete fell in a whiskey vat last week.
sentences.chinese: 叔叔皮特上個星期掉到裝威士忌的大桶裏。

sentences.english: The vat method, for example, can be used to dye wool with onionskins .
sentences.chinese: 例如大桶法，往往就是使用洋蔥皮來對毛線上色。

sentences.english: There are ten tuns that contain gum in the courtyard, the worker is boiling glue in busy move.
sentences.chinese: 院子裏擺放着十幾個盛膠的大桶，工人正在忙着熬膠。

sentences.english: The vat of oatmeal stood gasping on the electric range.
sentences.chinese: 那一大桶燕麥粥在電爐上撲哧撲哧作響。

sentences.english: Try the big tubs of coffee instead. They'll last and you'll save.
sentences.chinese: 試試大桶的咖啡，又實惠又省錢。

sentences.english: Flat twist curly hair for a big barrel-curl effect.
sentences.chinese: 平捻捲曲的頭髮一大桶捲曲效果。

sentences.english: The wine was racked off and poured into a big bucket.
sentences.chinese: 將酒榨出並灌入一個大桶中。

definition: jug (earthenware with a big belly and a small opening)
bucket/(trash) can/barrel (of oil etc)/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
washbowl/basin for washing hands and face/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 鍋|锅[guo1]/see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]/bowl (of a smoking pipe etc)
